descriptionHtml:
** CAUTION POSSIBLE SPOILER  **
Do not look further, or download this mod if you have not completed the quest \"Lights Out!\" with Jaree-Ra in Solitude.
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*

This mod simply replaces the Solitude Lighthouse fire-light. 

I felt pretty guilty after I was foolish enough to participate in Jaree-Ra\'s evil plans, and I always felt bad that the stupid and lazy lighthouse attendant, Ma\'zaka, never seemed to notice that the fire was out.  I always worried about other ships along the coast falling victim to the jagged shores of Solitude because of my reckless actions. 

I don\'t know anything about scripting, so my solution was to create a mod that just adds a new fire to the Solitude lighthouse.   There is no quest or in-game interaction needed with this mod, just drop it into to your Data folder and the next time you visit Solitude the fire should be re-lit.   No need to talk to Ma\'zaka (he\'s kind of a lazy putz anyway).

I have no idea if this mod will conflict with any others, or if it will work for you.   I can see the fire from the balcony at Proudspire Manor and any place in Tamriel where the lighthouse is visible, so it should work for you.  If it doesn\'t I won\'t know how to help you, but give it a try if you feel bad about what happened to the crew of the Icerunner, like I do.  It won\'t bring them back, but perhaps it will prevent some other poor souls from forfeiting their lives because of your selfishness and Jaree-Ra\'s deceit.

This mod comes as-is and I won\'t be upgrading or changing it, so don\'t ask.  This mod could break your game, corrupt your save-files, burn your house down and then insult you mother, so install it at your own risk.  If you think it\'s broken, fix it -- and re-post the fix. If you think you can do better, be my guest.  If you can do something cool with it like create a script that get Ma\'zaka to re-light it himself, please post it on the Nexus and let me know.

In any event, I hope this little mod helps you relieve some of your own guilt about dooming those poor sailors as it has helped me relieve a little of my own...
author: Hosidax
